translated: Birth Stories
The Group of Sixes
The Chapter on the Unprotected
The Birth Story of King Nandiya the Deer
“If you go, brahmin,

analyzed: sākete ajjunam vana  vajjā asi nandiyam nāma
translated: to the Ajuna Grove in Sāketa,🔽you will find our son,
the deer named Nandiya.
Your mother and father are old,
and they wish to see you.”

analyzed: bhuttā mayā nivāpāni  rājino pāna bhojana
translated: “I have eaten the king’s food,🔽his drink and meals.
I cannot refuse
the king’s food.”
“I will go out to hunt,
the king’s deer.
Then I will be happy and free,
and I will be able to see my mother.
In the past, I was a king of deer,
in the domain of Kosala.
My name was Nandiya,
a handsome four-legged animal.
He came to kill me

analyzed: dāyasmin ajjune vane  dhanum advejjham katvāna
translated: in the Ajuna Grove, my home.🔽The Kosalan king
strung his bow and aimed his arrow.
I went out to hunt,
the king’s deer.
Then I was happy and free,

analyzed: mātaram daṭṭhum āgatā uti 🔽nandi yamiga rāja jātakam dasama
translated: and I came to see my mother.”🔽The Birth Story of King Nandiya the Deer, the tenth.
The first sub-chapter on “not to be opened” is finished.
The first sub-chapter on “Not-to-be-revealed” is finished.🔽The summary:
Then, the bull of the caravan, the banner of the bull,
The face of the deer, the mountain, the creeper, and again;
Apananda, glory, the excellent mind,
Then, the righteous one, the deer of delight.
